metadata.titel_preek: The God of Small Things: St. Bede and the Evangelical Faith

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God initiates the restoration of His people and the building of His Church through insignificant means and people, overcoming historical and spiritual crises by His Spirit alone.

tekstueel_bewijs: Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit, says the Lord
God has determined the future of the church
The God of small things will build great things

object.identificatie: The Building of the Church / Restoration of the Covenant
tekstueel_bewijs: the true building of an eternal future
building up the family of God, the communion of saints, the Body of Christ

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Biblical Promise
tekstueel_bewijs: the promise of God is the foundation upon which it will be built
the word of the Lord to Zerubbabel

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The Hearers / The World
tekstueel_bewijs: brings to his saints the promise of the light of life
You are going to be built up by the Spirit here

helper.identificatie: Historical figures (Bede, Cuthbert, Zerubbabel, Doug Holmes) and the Word
tekstueel_bewijs: the plummet in the hand of Zerubbabel
what you have in Doug Holmes, is a leader like Zerubbabel
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; humans are instrumental helpers.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling and external power ('by my Spirit').

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Pride, and Cultural Disdain
tekstueel_bewijs: disdain oozing out of her voice
pride, greed, and lust for power
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The sermon identifies the opponents not just as social trends but as 'Sin and Death' and 'theological emergencies' that only God can resolve.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church (Subject) responds to God's grace by reforming itself and building up the body in love.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Congregation
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program of ethics/reformation is explicitly fueled by the primary program of God's promise.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has bound himself to them
God has determined the future of the church
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we throw ourselves upon the mercy of God
The church must always... seek the face of God

voorbeelden: The church must always, every day, seek the face of God
eagerness... to spread the word of salvation
reflect together on the meaning of evangelical faith
Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit
no obstacle can block it; no opposition can defeat it

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Pouvoir-faire' (Power-to-do) text. It emphasizes that human inability is met by Divine capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Exile/Crisis) through ~S1 (Human Might) to S1 (Grace/Spirit) via ~S2 (Small Things).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God choosing the 'not-S2' (small things) to manifest S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'theological emergency' of the exile is treated as a total loss of human hope.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject and humans as the receivers of a promise that does not depend on their 'might' or 'merit'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: what you have in Doug Holmes, is a leader like Zerubbabel

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has determined the future of the church.
not weighing our merits, but pardoning our offenses

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Bede and Zerubbabel are used as models, but their effectiveness is explicitly attributed to the Spirit, not their own virtues.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: God uses small things to show His greatness.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and confidence in God's agency rather than anxiety over performance.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic emphasis on the preservation of the Church.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The historical, biblical, and contemporary narratives are tightly woven around the single actantial engine of the Spirit's power.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'lovely building' and the 'redundant church' creates a brief moment of ethical demand.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: victorious work of Christ on the Cross in the overcoming of Sin and Death

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (Power) that the Subject lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a power to be 'overcome' by Christ, not just a mistake to be corrected.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a robustly theocentric narrative where God is the Subject and the Church is the Receiver of a promise.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: The balance is appropriate for an institution service.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's promise) correctly precedes and grounds Ethics (building the church).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the active verbs while addressing a specific human occasion.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of Bede as an ethos-builder, Greimas shows Bede is merely a 'Helper' to the divine 'Subject'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the historical Zerubbabel; semiotics shows Zerubbabel functions as a placeholder for the 'Pouvoir' of the Spirit.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the many human names (Bede, Cuthbert, Doug), the 'engine' of the sermon is entirely theocentric.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly warns against reading the Epistle as 'command' rather than 'promise', showing high semiotic awareness.
